intro: Tidestromia rhizomatosa, commonly known as the slender stemless goldenweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the western United States. It is characterized by its rhizomatous growth habit, which allows it to spread vegetatively and form dense colonies. The plant typically has basal leaves that are lanceolate and covered in fine hairs, and it produces small, yellow flowers in late spring. It thrives in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes. Its botanical features make it well-adapted to arid environments and a valuable component of native plant communities.
